triples.name: Feature selection
triples.relevance: The paper uses multiple feature selection methods (PCA, Chi-squared, ReliefF, and symmetrical uncertainty) to identify relevant features for heart disease prediction.

triples.name: Statistical classification
triples.relevance: The paper applies various classification algorithms including BayesNet to build predictive models for heart disease diagnosis.

triples.name: Cardiovascular disease
triples.relevance: Heart disease prediction is the medical problem the paper addresses using machine learning techniques.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is the overarching approach used to develop models for heart disease prediction and diagnosis.

triples.name: Principal component analysis
triples.relevance: PCA is one of the feature selection methods evaluated in the paper for reducing dimensionality in heart disease datasets.

triples.name: Chi-squared test
triples.relevance: The paper proposes and validates Chi-squared feature selection as the optimal method when combined with BayesNet, achieving 85% accuracy on heart disease datasets.

triples.name: Relief (feature selection)
triples.relevance: ReliefF is one of the feature selection algorithms evaluated for identifying relevant features in heart disease datasets.

triples.name: Uncertainty coefficient
triples.relevance: Symmetrical uncertainty is used as a feature selection technique based on information theory to measure associations between variables.

triples.name: Bayesian network
triples.relevance: BayesNet (Bayesian network) is the classification algorithm that achieved the best performance (85% accuracy) when combined with Chi-squared feature selection.

triples.name: Computer-aided diagnosis
triples.relevance: Computer-aided diagnosis is the application domain where machine learning models are used to improve the accuracy of heart disease prediction systems.
